title: Immport - basic study design template schema
description: Immport - basic study design template schema autogenerated by the CEDAR Template Editor

info.title: ImmPort - Basic Study Design
info.description: ImmPort - Basic Study Design Template (v2.29)

study.title: Study element schema
study.description: Study element schema autogenerated by the CEDAR Template Editor

info.title: study
info.description: Immport - study

info.title: User_Def_Study_ID
info.description: The study user defined ID is an identifier chosen by the data provider to refer to a study design. This ID may be referenced by other data records (e.g. arm). The user defined ID is not shared

info.title: Brief_Title
info.description: The brief title will be displayed on ImmPort wherever the study is described

info.title: Official_Title
info.description: The official study title is displayed on the ImmPort study detail page

info.title: Brief_Description
info.description: A brief study description highlights the essential features of a study.

info.title: Detailed_Description
info.description: The detailed description can be formatted with html tags to improve legibility. Embedded new line characters should be removed.

info.title: Hypothesis
info.description: The hypothesis can be formatted with html tags to improve legibility. Embedded new line characters should be removed.

info.title: Objectives
info.description: The objectives can be formatted with html tags to improve legibility. Embedded new line characters should be removed

info.title: Endpoints
info.description: The endpoints can be formatted with html tags to improve legibility. Embedded new line characters should be removed

info.title: Sponsoring_Organization
info.description: The organization that provides funding and support for the study

info.title: Target_Enrollment
info.description: The number of subjects proposed to be enrolled in the study

info.title: Condition_Studied
info.description: A short description of what is being researched or evaluated in the study (e.g. influenza)

info.title: Minimum_Age
info.description: The minimum age of subjects enrolled in the study

info.title: Maximum_Age
info.description: The maximum age of subjects enrolled in the study

info.title: Age_Unit
info.description: The unit of time used to describe the subject's age in the study

info.title: Intervention_Agent
info.description: If a study is interventional or has an interventional component, a short descriptive name of the intervention agent is requested

info.title: arm_or_cohort
info.description: Immport - arm_or_cohort

info.title: User_Def_Arm_Or_Cohort_ID
info.description: The study's arm(s) or cohort(s) group subjects by criteria relevant to the study (e.g. age, condition) and/or treatments or interventions. Insert rows in the template to define additional arms or cohorts linked to the study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort

info.title: Name
info.description: The arm or cohort name is not referenced by other data records.

info.title: Description
info.description: The description should expand any abbreviations used in the arm or cohort name. For example for an observational study with a cohort whose name was "ADEH+", the description would be "Atopic dermatitis with eczema herpeticum".

info.title: Population_Selection_Rule
info.description: For an observational study the rule may either be "Subjects selected by phenotypic characteristics", or the selection rule can provide additional information about population characteristics unique to the cohort. For an interventional study with the populations chosen by randomization the randomization rule should be specified (e.g. "randomized (1:1:1:1) to four treatment groups"). For an interventional study using rules other randomization these rules should be stated (e.g. "Selected by physician").

info.title: Sort_Order
info.description: Use this field to indicate if there is a preferred sort order of arms or cohorts. The contents of the field should be a positive whole number. Larger numbers are displayed later in Arm or Cohort lists.

info.title: Type
info.description: For an interventional study, the type defines the treatment/control attributes of the arms. The attributes are selected from the values listed below (a study may have more than one arm of a given value). Clinical studies often use the following terms. Experimental - Arm for procedure or drug being evaluated. Active Comparator - arm receiving "standard of care" treatment. Placebo Comparator - arm receiving placebo treatment. Sham Comparator - arm receiving a sham procedure such as a surgery or a sham device. No Intervention - arm receiving neither "standard of care" treatment a placebo, or sham procedure or device. For an observational study, the type should be Observational - All arms are observing differences in cohorts

info.title: study_personnel
info.description: Immport - study_personnel

info.title: User_Def_Study_Personnel_ID
info.description: The personnel user defined ID is an identifier chosen by the data provider to refer to personnel who may be contacted for more details about the study document. If more than one study personnel record is to be defined, copy the block of rows from User_Def_Study_Personnel_ID to Site_Name for each additional study personnel record. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

info.title: Honorific
info.description: Usually, the education achievement level of the person.

info.title: Last_Name
info.description: The last name of the study personnel being described.

info.title: First_Name
info.description: The first name of the study personnel being described.

info.title: Suffixes
info.description: Suffixes that are part of the study personnel's name being described.

info.title: Organization
info.description: The organization with whom the study personnel being described is affiliated.

info.title: Email
info.description: Contact information of the study personnel being described.

info.title: Title_In_Study
info.description: The role the personnel play in the study as defined by the research team.

info.title: Site_Name
info.description: Enter the site name if there is a need to further differentiate the affiliation of the study personnel form the Organization.

info.title: period
info.description: Immport - period

info.title: User_Def_Period_ID
info.description: The period user defined ID is an identifier chosen by the data provider to refer to a period within the study. This ID may be referenced by other data records (e.g. planned visit). The user defined ID is not shared. In many non-human research studies, there is a single period that spans the duration of the study. Insert rows in the template to define additional periods linked to the study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

info.title: Title
info.description: The period title is not referenced by other data records.

info.title: Order_Number
info.description: This is a positive whole number value.

info.title: planned_visit
info.description: ImmPort - planned_visit

info.title: User_Def_Planned_Visit_ID
info.description: The planned visit user defined ID is an identifier chosen by the data provider to refer to a planned visit. This ID may be referenced by other data records (e.g. biological samples). The user defined ID is not shared. Insert rows in the template to define additional planned visits linked to the study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

info.title: Visit_Name
info.description: the visit name should indicate the purpose of the visit (e.g. screening, assessment, inoculation, sample drawn). The visit name is not referenced by other data records.

info.title: Visit_Order_Number
info.description: This is a positive whole number value.

info.title: User_Def_Period_ID
info.description: The user defined period ID in planned visit should be an exact match to the period ID in the 'period' block of the study design.

info.title: Min_Start_Day
info.description: This is a positive or negative numeric value.

info.title: Max_Start_Day
info.description: This is a positive or negative numeric value. If no value is entered, the maximum start day will be set equal to the minimum start day.

info.title: Start_Rule
info.description: Enter a start rule only if it is more interesting than "subject has arrived for a scheduled visit".

info.title: End_Rule
info.description: Enter an end rule only if it is more interesting than "subject has arrived for a scheduled visit".

info.title: inclusion_exclusion
info.description: Immport - inclusion_exclusion

info.title: User_Def_Criterion_ID
info.description: The inclusion or exclusion user defined ID is an identifier chosen by the data provider to refer to a criterion used to determine whether a subject may be enrolled in a study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

info.title: Criterion
info.description: One or more criterion must be described to decide whether a subject may be enrolled in a study.

info.title: study_file
info.description: ImmPort - study_file

info.title: File_Name
info.description: If there are additional files (e.g. as data dictionaries, CRFs, custom formatted lab tests or assessments) that should be linked to the study please indicate them in this block. Insert rows in the template to link additional files to the study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort. The file size name limit is 250 characters. For a given study, all file names for study_file must be unique.

info.title: Description
info.description: A brief description of the file.

info.title: study_link
info.description: Immport - study_link

info.title: Link_Name
info.description: The name of the website to which the link refers. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

info.title: Link_Value
info.description: If this is a clinical trial, please include the clinicalTrial.gov URL.

info.title: study_pubmed_info
info.description: ImmPort - study_pubmed_info

info.title: Pubmed_ID
info.description: The Pubmed or PubMedCentral identifier of an article that includes data from this study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.

info.title: Pubmed_Title
info.description: The title of an article that includes data from this study.

info.title: Journal
info.description: The journal name that publishes an article that includes data from this study.

info.title: Year
info.description: The article publication year.

info.title: Month
info.description: The article publication month.

info.title: Issue
info.description: The journal's issue number.

info.title: Pages
info.description: The journal's page number.

info.title: Author
info.description: The article's authors.

study_2_protocol.title: Study_2_protocol element schema
study_2_protocol.description: Study_2_protocol element schema autogenerated by the CEDAR Template Editor

info.title: study_2_protocol
info.description: Immport - study_2_protocol

info.title: User_Def_Prot_ID
info.description: The protocol ID for the study. Use the basic_study_design_optional template to add additional records after a study is defined in ImmPort.
